_description: William Dunbar, ‘Of discretioun in asking’ — nine 5-line stanzas with refrain, ‘In asking sowld discretioun be’

CULLl510.First Lines:
Eftir everie asking followis nochtreward bot gif sum caus be
                    wrocht…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…But hart rakles or toung abaseitIn asking sould discretioun
                    be

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Eftir everie asking followis nochtRewarde bot gif sum caus be
                    wrocht…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…but hart rekles or toung abasitIn asking suld discretioun
                    be
CamMagPep2553.Note: Missing lines 16-20; no separation between this and 6002.
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.289-90.

Banna.First Lines:
Off every asking followis nochtRewaird bot gif sum caus war
                    wrocht…
Banna.Last Lines:
…To fecht with fortoun Is no witIn asking sowld descretioun
                    be
